monogr.title: The triades or trinities of Rome translated in to Englyshe : Them that synne rebuke openly that other may feare and drede. Timo.v
monogr.author: Hutten, Ulrich von

div.head: The preface
div.p:
GEntell reder / ye shal haue here gadred togeder those thynges / the whiche be eyther sette by / vsed / or hated at Rome. That place trewly may be called Rome / where such enormities be moche vsed. For so / after the mynde of Nicolas de Lira and other Saynte Peter in the ende of his fyrst Epystell / i. Pet. v. called Rome by the name of Babilon / bycause it was in Idolatry / lechery / and pryde. &c. at al poyntes lyke to it. And as it may be now called (for the same thynges / yee / & other moche worse / if worse may be) Sodoma or Gomurra / were it nat that they diffren in this one onely poynte / whiche is aboundaūce of brede & wyne.
For as in Gomurra & Sodome was great plentie of fode for euery man / so lykewise in Rome is the contrary therof / penury & scarsenesse of vitell / yee of al goodnesse / howbeit in that thynge / I thynke they agreen eche with other / so yt Rome may well be called Gomorra. Thinges gathered togider / I say / to thentent that vice ones knowen / it may the better be eschewed / and nat of malyce / as many (who nowe be rubbed on the gall) sayen. For if it come of malyce open lye to reproue vyce in theym / whom he that hath but halfe an eye / may se daily wtout all shame / & eke the drede & feare of god styll to contynue & delyte in their synne & abhominations.
Than surely / if it were nat to synne agaynst the holy gost to speke suche a blasphemy / I wolde saye that all the prophetes / that all Christes disciples / yee / that Christ him selfe: Alas that I am cōpelled nowe to open my lyppes to pronoūce this worde / Esa. xiii. malicious / Hier. l. li who is all good & full of the contrary to malyce that is charite / for my excuse.Dan. iiii Did / I pray you / Esaias / i. Cor̄. iiii v. vi. Hieremias / & Daniel / repreue ye babiloniēs / Actuū. v. & also their kyng Nabugodonosor of malice?Math. xxiii. Rebuked sait Paule the Corinthiens of their lyght iugement &Luc. x. of fornication of malyce?Mat. xi. Was saint Peter induced to blame Ananias & his wyfe Saphira / of crafte & auarice
by malyce? Ye / to be shorte / dyd nat Christ laye hipocrisy to the scribes & pharises charge / & that opēly? Dyd he nat vpbrayde the cyte of Corozaim / and other? but I hope ye wyll nat saye / inflamed with malyce. I passe ouer the malyce / that saynt Ierome / saint Crisostome / & Gyldas monacus / vsen in reprofe of synne / writyng to bysshops / to monkes / & to all other kynde of peple (wherof their workes be full) lest I shulde seme to feare / yt this alredy written were nat of strength ynough to {per}swade you / that it is nat of malyce. But hoow syr? Sōe man wyll say / no mā douteth of the goodnesse of these men But thynke ye / that the writers
nowe a dayes be of that sort? Whether they be of that sort or no / I wyl nothyng dispute / but me thinketh bicause it is an indifferent thynge / & maye be lightly doone / ye are blame worthy them so to iuge For Christe sayth:Mat. vii Nolite iudicare, et non iudicabimini. Whiche doctours expoūde to be mente of indifferēt thyng{is}. Agayn / either these thynges be fautes or nat fautes: that they be fautes / yee wyl nat agayn say I trow. That there be no suche fautes there vsed: I report me to your own cōscience / if this proue it nat / marke than commenly the lyuyng of these Rome rōners / who although / that a very fewe of them wyll denye it to
be so at Rōe by their mouth / Shal I waraūt you / cōfesse it opēly in their lyuyng / Thā me semeth that it were better to go about amendemēt / than in dispraysynge & leying malice to the auctors charge / seme rather to holde and defende abusion / than here of correction / for we shulde rather consyder what is written thā the writer. And to conclude / if no man shulde rebuke synne other than suche / whō the Romayns call Missi.
Missus Seute The sonne shulde soner lacke her lyght & lease her heate / than they the desyre & pleasure to contynue their abhomination. And more ouer Pasquyll the playne sayth / if he shulde nat speke agaynst prelates vyces in Rome
openly / but to them selfes preuyly in their chābres / that the mone wolde soner tourne him from an harde stone in to melow waxe / than he shulde be suffred to come in to one of their Palacyes: and bycause I thynke that Pasquyl sayth trouth I haue torned this boke out of latin in to englyshe as foloweth / for reformacion of synne.
